 "cells": [

   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 11,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Import numpy, pandas, linearsolve, matplotlib.pyplot\n",
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import pandas as pd\n",
    "import linearsolve2 as ls\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "plt.style.use('classic')\n",
    "%matplotlib inline"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Built-in Models\n",
    "\n",
    "`linearsolve` has two models pre-coded"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## AR(1) model\n",
    "\n",
    "The function `.ar1()` initializes the AR(1) process with mean $\\mu$ and autoregressive coeficient $\\rho$:\n",
    "\\begin{align}\n",
    "x_{t+1} & = (1-\\rho)\\mu + \\rho x_{t} + \\epsilon_{t+1}\n",
    "\\end{align}\n",
    "Default parameter settings:\n",
    "\n",
    "| $\\mu$ | $\\rho$ |\n",
    "|-------|--------|\n",
    "|  0    |  0.5   |\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": []
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 38,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot at 0x1017ce7208>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 38,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 432x288 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Initialize AR(1) model\n",
    "ar1 = ls.ar1()\n",
    "\n",
    "# Compute impulse response of one unit shock to \n",
    "ar1.impulse(T=26,t0=5) \n",
    "\n",
    "# Plot the impulse responses of x and e_x\n",
    "ar1.irs['e_x'].plot()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 37,
   "metadata": {
    "scrolled": false
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<matplotlib.legend.Legend at 0x1018d421d0>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 37,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 432x288 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "fig = plt.figure()\n",
    "ax = fig.add_subplot(1,1,1)\n",
    "for rho in [0.25,0.5,0.75,1]:\n",
    "    ar1 = ls.ar1(rho=rho)\n",
    "    ar1.stoch_sim(cov_mat = [[1]],seed=126,drop_first=0,T=101)\n",
    "    \n",
    "    ar1.simulated['x'].plot(ax=ax,label='$\\\\rho='+str(rho)+'$')\n",
    "    \n",
    "ax.legend(loc='center left', bbox_to_anchor=(1, 0.5))"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 19,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Help on method stoch_sim in module linearsolve2:\n",
      "\n",
      "stoch_sim(T=51, drop_first=300, cov_mat=None, seed=None, percent=False, diff=True) method of linearsolve2.model instance\n",
      "    Computes a stohcastic simulation of the model.\n",
      "    \n",
      "    Arguments:\n",
      "            T:          (int) Number of periods to simulate. Default: 51\n",
      "            drop_first: (int) Number of periods to simulate before generating the simulated periods. \n",
      "                            Default: 300\n",
      "            cov_mat:    (list or Numpy.ndarray) Covariance matrix shocks. If cov_mat is None, it's set to \n",
      "                            Numpy.eye(n_states). Default: None\n",
      "            seed:       (int) Sets the seed for the Numpy random number generator. Default: None\n",
      "            percent:    (bool) Whether to multiply simulated values by 100. Only works for log-linear \n",
      "                            approximations. Default: False\n",
      "            diff:       (bool) Subtract steady state for linear approximations (or log steady state for \n",
      "                            log-linear approximations). Default: True\n",
      "    \n",
      "    Returns\n",
      "        None\n",
      "    \n",
      "    Attributes:\n",
      "        simulated:    (Pandas DataFrame)\n",
      "\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "help(ar1.stoch_sim)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 10,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Help on function ar1 in module linearsolve2:\n",
      "\n",
      "ar1(mu=0, rho=0.5)\n",
      "    Initiates an AR(1) model in linearsolve, computes the steady state, and solves the \n",
      "    model.\n",
      "    \n",
      "    Args:\n",
      "        mu:             (float) Mean of the process.\n",
      "        rho:            (float) Autoregressive coefficient of the process.\n",
      "    \n",
      "    Returns:\n",
      "        linersolve.model\n",
      "    \n",
      "    Attributes:\n",
      "\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "help(ls.ar1)"
   ]
